Package fsm

Class FSMServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • fsm.FSMServer
  • public class FSMServer
extends java.lang.Object
    FSMServer is an implementation of a Mealy Machine specialized to represent a Server with all its interactions

    An FSMServer is characterized by :

    • A name
    • A list of States owned by the machine
    • References to a starting one, a current one and a final one
    • A collection to store data in the fsm characterizing the current state of the application

    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    Arthur Depasse

    • Constructor Detail

      • FSMServer

        public FSMServer​(java.lang.String name,
                 java.util.function.BiFunction<javafx.util.Pair<java.util.UUID,java.io.DataInputStream>,FSMServer,NetworkMessageParser> parserFactory,
                 int port,
                 java.lang.String keystorePwd)
        The constructor of the class.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the FSM to create
        parserFactory - the factory used to instantiate new parsers
        port - the port on which the server must listen
        keystorePwd - the password of the keystore used for SSL and TLS protocols

    • Method Detail

      • setData

        public void setData​(java.lang.String name,
                    java.lang.Object data)
        A function to set data in the internal storage of the FSM. This data may later be accessed through getData(String).
        Parameters:
        name - the string identifier of the data
        data - the data
        See Also:
        getData(String), data

      • getData

        public java.lang.Object getData​(java.lang.String name)
        A function to access data in the internal storage of the FSM. Data may be set with setData(String, Object).
        Parameters:
        name - the string identifier of the data to fetch.
        Returns:
        An Object corresponding to the data. You must cast it back to its original type before using it.
        See Also:
        setData(String, Object), data

        public NetworkMessageParser newParser​(java.util.UUID id,

        A function that instantiate a new NetworkMessageParser or an inherited class according to the factory function provided by the user via the constructor FSMServer(String, BiFunction, int, String)
